UseCaseTitle: AI Agent for Optimizing Healthcare Patient Flow
Purpose: To streamline and optimize patient movement across hospital departments, ensuring efficient utilization of resources and enhancing the patient care journey.
ExecSummary: Hospitals often struggle with delays in patient transfers, departmental bottlenecks, and inefficient utilization of critical care resources. This solution uses AI agents and a real-time knowledge graph to manage and optimize patient flow dynamically across departments, improving both patient experience and operational outcomes.
ExecSummaryKeyAsks: Track and predict patient flow across hospital departments
Improve coordination between emergency, inpatient, and diagnostic teams
Ensure optimal use of beds, equipment, and personnel
BusinessObjectives: Reduce patient wait times and delays in care transitions
Increase hospital throughput without additional staffing
Enable real-time, intelligent decision-making for patient routing
BusinessBenefits: Better care continuity and reduced patient dissatisfaction
overview: This demo illustrates a real-time AI-based orchestration platform that models and optimizes patient movement across a healthcare facility using multi-agent systems, contextual awareness, and graph-driven insights.
business: Healthcare operations often suffer from manual coordination, siloed departments, and data latency. Inefficient patient flow contributes to longer stays, delayed discharges, and staff burnout. This use case introduces an intelligent layer that dynamically coordinates patient routing based on real-time resource availability.
approach: The system uses React and Flask for interface and orchestration, and Neo4j to maintain a dynamic graph of patient journeys, departmental capacities, and equipment availability. Autonomous agents analyze context and optimize decisions across various hospital functions.
BusinessDrivers: Enhance staff communication and role-based task allocation
BusinessChallanges: No centralized view of bed and equipment availability
Reactive instead of proactive patient movement decisions
Inability to scale during surges (e.g., pandemics)
FunctionalOverview: Real-time Patient Tracking: Live view of patient location, movement, and care status
Flow Optimization Engine: AI-based logic that prioritizes patient transitions
Departmental Coordination: Automatic alerts and task routing to staff
Graph-Based Decision Support: Use of Neo4j to model care journey and dependencies
Bottleneck Detection: Early warning when a department is at risk of overload

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Monitors patients and orchestrates transitions using real-time data and predefined care rules.
KeyFeatures: Custom alerts for delays or overloads
BusinessImpact: Reduces manual intervention in patient transfers
Speeds up discharge and admission processes

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Central interface for hospital administrators to visualize and intervene in patient flow.
KeyFeatures: Manual override and staff assignment tools

SolutionOverview: Agent-based orchestration of patient routing across departments
Neo4j-powered graph for real-time patient and resource mapping
Flask-based backend APIs integrated with hospital systems (HIS, EHR)
React frontend for dashboards and alerts
Context-aware load balancing logic to optimize bed and equipment usage
dataflow: Patient admission triggers flow initiation via the Patient Flow Agent. Real-time data is pushed to the Neo4j graph and visualized on the dashboard. Capacity and Alert Agents monitor thresholds and push alerts or rerouting instructions as needed. Staff actions update the graph to maintain state consistency.
design: Each agent follows a state-driven execution model with asynchronous triggers. Flask provides API middleware, and Neo4j ensures high-performance graph operations. React dashboards consume and visualize insights for human-in-the-loop interaction. All components are containerized and scalable.
